name: PlayFab Postman SDK 0.27.160829
description:
PlayFab API SDK for Postman.

This is still under development, and is not yet ready for general use.  Experienced users can utilize this if they carefully examine the post-body and ensure the data is properly entered.  By default, the post-body is NOT defaulting to useable values.

requests.name: AddNews
requests.description:
Adds a new news item to the title's news feed

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/AddNews

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Timestamp": Time this news was published. If not set, defaults to now.

"Title": Title (headline) of the news item

"Body": Body text of the news

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: AddPlayerTag
requests.description:
Adds a given tag to a player profile. The tag's namespace is automatically generated based on the source of the tag.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/AddPlayerTag

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"PlayFabId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

"TagName": Unique tag for player profile.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: AddServerBuild
requests.description:
Adds the game server executable specified (previously uploaded - see GetServerBuildUploadUrl) to the set of those a client is permitted to request in a call to StartGame

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/AddServerBuild

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"BuildId": unique identifier for the build executable

"CommandLineTemplate": appended to the end of the command line when starting game servers

"ExecutablePath": path to the game server executable. Defaults to gameserver.exe

"ActiveRegions": server host regions in which this build should be running and available

"Comment": developer comment(s) for this build

"MaxGamesPerHost": maximum number of game server instances that can run on a single host machine

"MinFreeGameSlots": minimum capacity of additional game server instances that can be started before the autoscaling service starts new host machines (given the number of current running host machines and game server instances)

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: GetPlayersInSegment
requests.description:
Allows for paging through all players in a given segment. This API creates a snapshot of all player profiles that match the segment definition at the time of its creation and lives through the Total Seconds to Live, refreshing its life span on each subsequent use of the Continuation Token. Profiles that change during the course of paging will not be reflected in the results. AB Test segments are currently not supported by this operation.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/GetPlayersInSegment

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"SegmentId": Unique identifier for this segment.

"SecondsToLive": Number of seconds to keep the continuation token active. After token expiration it is not possible to continue paging results. Default is 300 (5 minutes). Maximum is 1,800 (30 minutes).

"MaxBatchSize": Maximum number of profiles to load. Default is 1,000. Maximum is 10,000.

"ContinuationToken": Continuation token if retrieving subsequent pages of results.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: SetupPushNotification
requests.description:
Sets the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for iOS and Android push notifications. Documentation on the exact restrictions can be found at: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/api/API_CreatePlatformApplication.html. Currently, Amazon device Messaging is not supported.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/SetupPushNotification

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Name": name of the application sending the message (application names must be made up of only uppercase and lowercase ASCII letters, numbers, underscores, hyphens, and periods, and must be between 1 and 256 characters long)

"Platform": supported notification platforms are Apple Push Notification Service (APNS and APNS_SANDBOX) for iOS and Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) for Android

"Key": for APNS, this is the PlatformPrincipal (SSL Certificate)

"Credential": Credential is the Private Key for APNS/APNS_SANDBOX, and the API Key for GCM

"OverwriteOldARN": replace any existing ARN with the newly generated one. If this is set to false, an error will be returned if notifications have already setup for this platform.

requests.name: GetContentDownloadUrl
requests.description:
This API retrieves a pre-signed URL for accessing a content file for the title. A subsequent  HTTP GET to the returned URL will attempt to download the content. A HEAD query to the returned URL will attempt to  retrieve the metadata of the content. Note that a successful result does not guarantee the existence of this content -  if it has not been uploaded, the query to retrieve the data will fail. See this post for more information:  https://community.playfab.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/205469488-How-to-upload-files-to-PlayFab-s-Content-Service

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/GetContentDownloadUrl

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Key": Key of the content item to fetch, usually formatted as a path, e.g. images/a.png

"HttpMethod": HTTP method to fetch item - GET or HEAD. Use HEAD when only fetching metadata. Default is GET.

"ThruCDN": True if download through CDN. CDN provides better download bandwidth and time. However, if you want latest, non-cached version of the content, set this to false. Default is true.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: GetPlayersInSegment
requests.description:
Allows for paging through all players in a given segment. This API creates a snapshot of all player profiles that match the segment definition at the time of its creation and lives through the Total Seconds to Live, refreshing its life span on each subsequent use of the Continuation Token. Profiles that change during the course of paging will not be reflected in the results. AB Test segments are currently not supported by this operation.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/GetPlayersInSegment

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"SegmentId": Unique identifier for this segment.

"SecondsToLive": Number of seconds to keep the continuation token active. After token expiration it is not possible to continue paging results. Default is 300 (5 minutes). Maximum is 1,800 (30 minutes).

"MaxBatchSize": Maximum number of profiles to load. Default is 1,000. Maximum is 10,000.

"ContinuationToken": Continuation token if retrieving subsequent pages of results.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: LogEvent
requests.description:
As of 4/1/2016, this API has been proposed for deprecation. As of 9/10/2016, it will be officially deprecated and no longer supported.

Please use the replacement API instead: WritePlayerEvent

Logs a custom analytics event

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"PlayFabId": PlayFab User Id of the player associated with this event. For non-player associated events, this must be null and EntityId must be set.

"EntityId": For non player-associated events, a unique ID for the entity associated with this event. For player associated events, this must be null and PlayFabId must be set.

"EntityType": For non player-associated events, the type of entity associated with this event. For player associated events, this must be null.

"Timestamp": Optional timestamp for this event. If null, the a timestamp is auto-assigned to the event on the server.

"EventName": A unique event name which will be used as the table name in the Redshift database. The name will be made lower case, and cannot not contain spaces. The use of underscores is recommended, for readability. Events also cannot match reserved terms. The PlayFab reserved terms are 'log_in' and 'purchase', 'create' and 'request', while the Redshift reserved terms can be found here: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_pg_keywords.html.

"Body": Contains all the data for this event. Event Values can be strings, booleans or numerics (float, double, integer, long) and must be consistent on a per-event basis (if the Value for Key 'A' in Event 'Foo' is an integer the first time it is sent, it must be an integer in all subsequent 'Foo' events). As with event names, Keys must also not use reserved words (see above). Finally, the size of the Body for an event must be less than 32KB (UTF-8 format).

"ProfileSetEvent": Flag to set event Body as profile details in the Redshift database as well as a standard event.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: UnlockContainerInstance
requests.description:
Opens a specific container (ContainerItemInstanceId), with a specific key (KeyItemInstanceId, when required), and returns the contents of the opened container. If the container (and key when relevant) are consumable (RemainingUses > 0), their RemainingUses will be decremented, consistent with the operation of ConsumeItem.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/UnlockContainerInstance

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"PlayFabId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

"CharacterId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

"ContainerItemInstanceId": ItemInstanceId of the container to unlock.

"KeyItemInstanceId": ItemInstanceId of the key that will be consumed by unlocking this container.  If the container requires a key, this parameter is required.

"CatalogVersion": Specifies the catalog version that should be used to determine container contents.  If unspecified, uses catalog associated with the item instance.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: UnlockContainerItem

Retrieves the specified character's current inventory of virtual goods

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/GetCharacterInventory

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"CharacterId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

"CatalogVersion": Used to limit results to only those from a specific catalog version.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: GetCharacterLeaderboard
requests.description:

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"CharacterType": Optional character type on which to filter the leaderboard entries.

"StatisticName": Unique identifier for the title-specific statistic for the leaderboard.

"StartPosition": First entry in the leaderboard to be retrieved.

"MaxResultsCount": Maximum number of entries to retrieve. Default 10, maximum 100.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

requests.name: GetCloudScriptUrl
requests.description:
As of 3/28/2016, this API has been proposed for deprecation. As of 9/10/2016, it will be officially deprecated and no longer supported.

Please use the replacement API instead: ExecuteCloudScript

Retrieves the title-specific URL for Cloud Script servers. This must be queried once, prior  to making any calls to RunCloudScript.

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Version": Cloud Script Version to use. Defaults to 1.

"Testing": Specifies whether the URL returned should be the one for the most recently uploaded Revision of the Cloud Script (true), or the Revision most recently set to live (false). Defaults to false.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: GetContentDownloadUrl
requests.description:
This API retrieves a pre-signed URL for accessing a content file for the title. A subsequent  HTTP GET to the returned URL will attempt to download the content. A HEAD query to the returned URL will attempt to  retrieve the metadata of the content. Note that a successful result does not guarantee the existence of this content -  if it has not been uploaded, the query to retrieve the data will fail. See this post for more information:  https://community.playfab.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/205469488-How-to-upload-files-to-PlayFab-s-Content-Service

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/GetContentDownloadUrl

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Key": Key of the content item to fetch, usually formatted as a path, e.g. images/a.png

"HttpMethod": HTTP method to fetch item - GET or HEAD. Use HEAD when only fetching metadata. Default is GET.

"ThruCDN": True if download through CDN. CDN provides better download bandwidth and time. However, if you want latest, non-cached version of the content, set this to false. Default is true.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: GetUserCombinedInfo
requests.description:
As of 6/30/2016, this API has been proposed for deprecation. As of 10/10/2016, it will be officially deprecated and no longer supported.

Please use the replacement API instead: GetPlayerCombinedInfo

NOTE: This call will be deprecated soon. For fetching the data for a given user  use GetPlayerCombinedInfo. For looking up users from the client api, we are in the process of adding a new api call. Once that call is ready, this one will be deprecated.  Retrieves all requested data for a user in one unified request. By default, this API returns all  data for the locally signed-in user. The input parameters may be used to limit the data retrieved to any subset of the available data, as well as retrieve the available data for a different user. Note that certain data, including inventory, virtual currency balances, and personally identifying information, may only be retrieved for the locally signed-in user. In the example below, a request is made for the account details, virtual currency balances, and specified user data for the locally signed-in user.

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"PlayFabId": Unique PlayFab identifier of the user whose info is being requested. Optional, defaults to the authenticated user if no other lookup identifier set.

"Username": PlayFab Username for the account to find (if no PlayFabId is specified).

"Email": User email address for the account to find (if no Username is specified).

"TitleDisplayName": Title-specific username for the account to find (if no Email is set).

"GetAccountInfo": If set to false, account info will not be returned. Defaults to true.

"GetInventory": If set to false, inventory will not be returned. Defaults to true. Inventory will never be returned for users other than yourself.

"GetVirtualCurrency": If set to false, virtual currency balances will not be returned. Defaults to true. Currency balances will never be returned for users other than yourself.

"GetUserData": If set to false, custom user data will not be returned. Defaults to true.

"UserDataKeys": User custom data keys to return. If set to null, all keys will be returned. For users other than yourself, only public data will be returned.

"GetReadOnlyData": If set to false, read-only user data will not be returned. Defaults to true.

"ReadOnlyDataKeys": User read-only custom data keys to return. If set to null, all keys will be returned. For users other than yourself, only public data will be returned.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: GetUserData
requests.description:
Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Keys": Specific keys to search for in the custom data. Leave null to get all keys.

"PlayFabId": Unique PlayFab identifier of the user to load data for. Optional, defaults to yourself if not set. When specified to a PlayFab id of another player, then this will only return public keys for that account.

"IfChangedFromDataVersion": The version that currently exists according to the caller. The call will return the data for all of the keys if the version in the system is greater than this.

requests.name: LogEvent
requests.description:
As of 4/1/2016, this API has been proposed for deprecation. As of 9/10/2016, it will be officially deprecated and no longer supported.

Please use the replacement API instead: WritePlayerEvent

Logs a custom analytics event

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Timestamp": Optional timestamp for this event. If null, the a timestamp is auto-assigned to the event on the server.

"EventName": A unique event name which will be used as the table name in the Redshift database. The name will be made lower case, and cannot not contain spaces. The use of underscores is recommended, for readability. Events also cannot match reserved terms. The PlayFab reserved terms are 'log_in' and 'purchase', 'create' and 'request', while the Redshift reserved terms can be found here: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/r_pg_keywords.html.

"Body": Contains all the data for this event. Event Values can be strings, booleans or numerics (float, double, integer, long) and must be consistent on a per-event basis (if the Value for Key 'A' in Event 'Foo' is an integer the first time it is sent, it must be an integer in all subsequent 'Foo' events). As with event names, Keys must also not use reserved words (see above). Finally, the size of the Body for an event must be less than 32KB (UTF-8 format).

"ProfileSetEvent": Flag to set event Body as profile details in the Redshift database as well as a standard event.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: Matchmake
requests.description:
Attempts to locate a game session matching the given parameters. If the goal is to match the player into a specific active session, only the LobbyId is required. Otherwise, the BuildVersion, GameMode, and Region are all required parameters. Note that parameters specified in the search are required (they are not weighting factors). If a slot is found in a server instance matching the parameters, the slot will be assigned to that player, removing it from the availabe set. In that case, the information on the game session will be returned, otherwise the Status returned will be GameNotFound. Note that EnableQueue is deprecated at this time.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/Matchmake

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"BuildVersion": Build version to match against. [Note: Required if LobbyId is not specified]

"Region": Region to match make against. [Note: Required if LobbyId is not specified]

"GameMode": Game mode to match make against. [Note: Required if LobbyId is not specified]

"LobbyId": Lobby identifier to match make against. This is used to select a specific Game Server Instance.

"StatisticName": Player statistic to use in finding a match. May be null for no stat-based matching.

"CharacterId": Character to use for stats based matching. Leave null to use account stats.

"StartNewIfNoneFound": Start a game session if one with an open slot is not found. Defaults to true.

"TagFilter": Filter to include and/or exclude Game Server Instances associated with certain Tags

"EnableQueue": Deprecated - Do not use

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: RunCloudScript
requests.description:
As of 3/28/2016, this API has been proposed for deprecation. As of 9/10/2016, it will be officially deprecated and no longer supported.

Please use the replacement API instead: ExecuteCloudScript

Triggers a particular server action, passing the provided inputs to the hosted Cloud Script. An action in this context is a handler in the JavaScript. NOTE: Before calling this API, you must call GetCloudScriptUrl to be assigned a Cloud Script server URL. When using an official PlayFab SDK, this URL is stored internally in the SDK, but GetCloudScriptUrl must still be manually called.

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"ActionId": server action to trigger

requests.name: UpdateUserStatistics
requests.description:
As of 3/1/2016, this API has been proposed for deprecation. As of 9/10/2016, it will be officially deprecated and no longer supported.

Please use the replacement API instead: UpdatePlayerStatistics

Updates the values of the specified title-specific statistics for the user. By default, clients are not permitted to update statistics. Developers may override this setting in the Game Manager > Settings > API Features.

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"UserStatistics": Statistics to be updated with the provided values. UserStatistics object must follow the Key(string), Value(int) pattern.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"CurrencyCode": Currency used for the purchase.

requests.name: WriteCharacterEvent
requests.description:
Writes a character-based event into PlayStream.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/WriteCharacterEvent

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"CharacterId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

"EventName": The name of the event, within the namespace scoped to the title. The naming convention is up to the caller, but it commonly follows the subject_verb_object pattern (e.g. player_logged_in).

"Timestamp": The time (in UTC) associated with this event. The value dafaults to the current time.

"Body": Custom event properties. Each property consists of a name (string) and a value (JSON object).

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add".
